main: ^It is also known as Hagdan-hagdan Palayan ng Banawe. These are terraces that were carved into the mountains of Banaue, Province of Ifugao in the Philippines, by the ancestors of the Igorot people more than 2000 years ago using minimal tools and mostly by hand.

c-0: ^The terraces are occasionally called the "Eighth Wonder of the World".
^These are fed by an ancient irrigation system from the rainforests above the terraces and locals up to this day still plant rice and vegetables onto it.
